Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a specific land habitat (like a playground, garden, forest, or parking lot) or a water habitat (like a pond, stream, or lake).

The student can include different types of living things in the drawing, like trees, grasses, bushes, flowering plants, lizards, squirrels, ants, fish, or clams, that might be found in the chosen habitat.
The student can show how these living things are distributed within the habitat, highlighting any patterns in where different plants and animals are located.
The student can use the drawing to compare the types of living things in one habitat with those in another habitat, if possible.
The student can explain through the drawing how these observations show patterns in plant and animal diversity across different habitats.
